result.execSummary:
The defendant Robyn R Richardson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-First 6 months straight-time. 
-Last 6 months Huber with standard release conditions.
Concurrent with: -With sentence in 19CF50 IF revoked.

miscConds.notes:
-Standard court costs waived. DNA Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation. 
-Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

-Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent. 
-Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent. 
-No count with Victim A and Linden Grove listed in the criminal complaint in 19CF50.
-AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended. 
-Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended, 
-If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robyn R Richardson

defendant.name: Richardson, Robyn R
defendant.address: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

2:53 PM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing. Defendant Robyn R Richardson in court, in custody.  Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Robyn R Richardson.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court notes a plea questionnaire as been filed and recites the offer listed in the document.  State and Defense confirm the offer.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1, Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1. 

Sentencing arguments made by the State.
Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Miller. 
Defendant presents statements.

COUNT 1:
The Court Orders the Following:

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

1 Year Jail Total (40 Days Credit & concurrent to sentence in 19CF50 IF revoked and imposed) - 
First 6 Months Straight Time; 
Last 6 Months Huber with standard release conditions.

Term of Probation: 2 Years

Conditions of Probation:
-	Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
-	Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent;
-	No contact with Victim A and Linden Grove listed in the Criminal Complaint in 19CF50.
-	AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
-	Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.  

COSTS:  Waived by the Court.

DNA Surcharge: $250.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid as a condition of probation. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:05 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robyn R Richardson in court, in custody.  Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Robyn R Richardson.  Attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Miller provides an update; she is requesting a plea and sentencing date in about 3-4 weeks.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

9:48 AM Defendant Robyn R Richardson in court, in custody.  Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Robyn R Richardson.  Attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for State of Wisconsin. 

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Officer John Schubel, of the Villiage of Mukwonago Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by ADA Sitzberger.
Cross examination by attorney Miller.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State presents closing arguments and moves for bind over.
The Defense presents closing arguments and objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
